name: Department of Justice
description: The Department of Justice enforces the law, defends the interests of the United States, ensures public safety, prevents and controls crime, seeks just punishment, and ensures fair and impartial administration of justice.

painPoints.point: IT infrastructure modernization across multiple components including FBI, DEA, ATF, and US Marshals Service
Cybersecurity and data protection critical for sensitive law enforcement and investigative information
Case management and litigation support system improvements for federal prosecutors and courts
Digital evidence management and forensic analysis system modernization
Data analytics and intelligence systems for threat detection and criminal investigation
Legacy system integration and migration challenges across multiple law enforcement components
IT acquisition and management challenges including project delays, budget overruns, and need for improved oversight and mature acquisition practices affecting law enforcement IT systems
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving IT Acquisitions and Management

strategicPriorities.priority: Case Management and Litigation Support System Improvements
Digital Evidence and Forensic Analysis Systems

secondary: GAO Reports on DOJ IT Systems and Cybersecurity

evaluationFactors: Past performance with government or law enforcement systems

keyOffices: Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO)
Office of Small and Disadvantaged Business Utilization (OSDBU)
Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF)
insights: Cybersecurity is critical priority due to sensitive law enforcement data
IT infrastructure modernization across multiple components is major focus
Digital evidence and forensic analysis systems are high priority
Case management and litigation support system improvements ongoing
Strong emphasis on data analytics and intelligence capabilities
Clearance requirements may be needed for some contracts
